Title.evidence: We conducted a multisite, randomized controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of a mobile web application, Inform Me, for increasing knowledge about IRDs.

Trial_Design.evidence: KTCs undergoing transplant evaluation at 2 transplant centers were randomized to use Inform Me after routine transplant education (intervention) or routine transplant education alone (control).

Participants.evidence: KTCs undergoing transplant evaluation at 2 transplant centers

Intervention.evidence: randomized to use Inform Me after routine transplant education (intervention) or routine transplant education alone (control).

Objective.evidence: We conducted a multisite, randomized controlled trial to evaluate the efficacy of a mobile web application, Inform Me, for increasing knowledge about IRDs.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Knowledge (primary outcome) was assessed in person after education (Tests 1 and 2), and 1-week later by telephone (Test 3).

Number_Analysed.evidence: Multiple imputation was used for intention-to-treat analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intervention participants had higher Test 1 knowledge scores (mean difference=6.61; 95% CI, 5.37–7.86) than control participants
